intro: Tanaecium mutabile, commonly known as the variable tanaecium, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
